response:
Up Against the Wall Motherfucker, often shortened as The Motherfuckers or UAWMF, was a revolutionary political group that existed from 1962 (with its founding as the Liberation Front) to 1971. Based in New York City, the group made a name for itself largely based on its radical anti-authority orientation and its provocative use of obscenity. It operated primarily through the use of street theater and other forms of public action, including some that crossed the line into petty criminal activity. UAWMF was a prominent fixture in the political landscape of the 1960s and was especially involved with movements related to the Civil Rights, anti-war (particularly in Vietnam) and student revolutions—or rebellions—throughout the years. The group was especially associated with many of the radical elements of hippie counterculture, particularly after their infamous riot at the 1969 Woodstock Festival. The group was known for their militant positions and advocated armed revolution to achieve its ideals, in addition to their street activity. Despite declaring itself an officially Trotskyist organization, the group was known for its lack of direction and organization and did not have regular leadership beyond a loose core of prominent figures in political circles. The Motherfuckers were also deeply involved with drugs, particularly heroin, which helped fuel the group’s decline.
